html:
8.4.19  4:22 pm   8.4.19  12:50 pm do you find that in those no-keyboard-shortcut, no-menu-item ones you usually get click static text?

      Weird question on my part, but have u made sure to have only 1 instance of whatever it is you're manipulating?

      static usually means theres only 1 instance of that value so idk if having several might trip it out,

      im just throwing out ideas while i understand more of the issue. Feel free to use me as a rubber duck


embedded answer: https://billwurtz.com/questions/q.php?date=201908041250

8.4.19  12:50 pm   Regarding your AppleScript issue: I've had trouble getting my GUI actions to be recorded by pointing and clicking with a mouse. I DO get the results I want by outlining the keyboard shortcuts for the specific app. Good luck!

     actually, the main point of this particular operation is to have solutions for those strange situations where there is absolutely no keyboard shortcut, nor menu item (if it was a menu item i could make a keyboard shortcut for it, but some software likes to go to more advanced planes of inaccessibility)

      AppleScript keycodes: https://eastmanreference.com/complete-list-of-applescript-key-codes

Example used with my video editing software:

tell application "System Events"
key code 0 using {command down} # select all
        delay 0.5
        key code 44 using {shift down, command down} # select top menu
delay 0.5
repeat 3 times # arrow left over to Action menu
key code 123
end repeat
delay 1
repeat 7 times # arrow down to Templates
original_html:

      static usually means theres only 1 instance of that value so idk if having several might trip it out,

      im just throwing out ideas while i understand more of the issue. Feel free to use me as a rubber duck

8.3.19  5:28 am   how's the technological advancement going? did you figure out the 'missing value' issue?

      NO THAT'S THE HOTTEST ISSUE ON MY LIST RIGHT NOW, IF ANYONE CAN FIGURE THAT OUT AND WOULD BE KIND ENOUGH TO HELP, PLEASE CONTACT ME. THE QUESTION IS, HOW DO I RECORD MY ACTIONS IN A MACOS APP AND HAVE IT PRODUCE THE CODE FOR WHAT I JUST DID IN EITHER APPLESCRIPT OR JXA, CORRECTLY. AUTOMATOR WATCH-ME-DO SOMETIMES GIVES ME THIS CORRECTLY FOR SIMPLE DIALOGS, BUT FOR OTHER GUI ELEMENTS IT FAILS, SPECIFICALLY FOR EXAMPLE WHEN I CLICK CERTAIN GUI ELEMENTS THE AUTOMATOR WATCH ME DO WILL CLAIM THAT THE APPLE SCRIPT FOR THAT WAS "CLICK STATIC TEXT" OF ETC ETC WHICH IF I TURN AROUND AND RUN THAT IN APPLESCRIPT IT WILL SIMPLY SAY "MISSING VALUE." THE QUESTION IS HOW DO I FIND OUT WHAT THE CORRECT SCRIPT CODES ARE FOR MY FAVORITE GUI ACTIONS thanks for your consideration, prize offered
